discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
8Gbps FC SFP can support 4Gbps, so it seems A is correct

Indeed A, since FC SFP are multi-speed capable

Cisco 8-Gbps Fibre Channel SFP+ modules provide Fibre Channel connectivity for the 2/4/8 Gbps ports
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/products/collateral/storage-networking/mds-9000-series-multilayer-switches/product_data_sheet09186a00801bc698.html

Yes A.
“SFP Validation Failed” suggests incorrect port speed, most likely due to it being configured for 10G Ethernet.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. When an engineer inserts 8-Gb Fibre Channel SFP port 15 on a Cisco UCS Fabric Interconnect, the port fails. What is causing this issue?

choices.D: The polarity of the fiber cable is reversed.
choices.A: Port 15 is configured as an Ethernet port.
choices.B: Port 15 is configured for 4-Gb Fibre Channel.

discussion.content:
Correct is A

Reason:
When a new NP uplink interface becomes operational, the existing load is not redistributed automatically to
include the newly available uplink. Server interfaces that become operational after the NP uplink can select
the new NP uplink.

https://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/switches/datacenter/nexus5000/sw/configuration/guide/cli_rel_4_1/Cisco_Nexus_5000_Series_Switch_CLI_Software_Configuration_Guide_chapter35.pdf

questions.question_text: An engineer discovers that an NPV/NPIV uplink experiences a heavy load and plans to add more uplinks. What occurs when the new uplinks are added to the uplink?

choices.A: Only new connections automatically use the new uplinks.
choices.C: All connections must be reset before the new uplinks are used.
choices.D: New and existing connections automatically use the new uplinks.
choices.B: Paths must be defined before new connections use the new uplinks.

choices.D: Reset the port for FC ID 0x970209 and FC ID 0x9700c2 to log in to the fabric.
choices.A: Reconfigure the initiator and the target to be in the same zones.
choices.C: Reset the port for FC ID 0x970102 and FC ID 0x970200 to log in to the fabric.

discussion.content: It's A, that's the basics. Members of different zones cannot access each other.

Selected Answer: A
Members in a zone can access each other; members in different zones cannot access each other. the basic.
For B to be correct, there would need to be pending changes in the zoneset, we don't have any way from the output shown to know that. I think it's A.
Answer is B isn't it? - they're in different zones (sorry, typo in earlier comment)

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. The initiator that has FC ID 0x970102 fails to communicate with the target that has FC ID 0x970200. Which action resolves the issue?

discussion.content:
I think the correct answer is B
The interface command ip ospf mtu-ignore disables this check of the MTU value in the OSPF DBD packets. Thus, use of this command allows the OSPF adjacency to reach the FULL state even though there is an interface MTU mismatch between two OSPF routers.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/ip/open-shortest-path-first-ospf/119384-technote-ospf-00.html

I think the correct answer is A.
That because the MTU parameter must match between the neighbors or the protocol messages will not be properly exhanged.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. An OSPF adjacency between Router-A and Router-B fails to reach the FULL state. Which action resolves the issue?

choices.B: Disable the check of the MTU value.
choices.D: Adjust the MTU on Router-B to 1604.
choices.C: Set the OSPF media type to point-to-point.
choices.A: Adjust the MTU on Router-A to 1600.
The host has not responded to the Control Sub-TLV DCBX exchanges of the switch.
choices.C: Cisco Discovery Protocol is disabled on the switch.
choices.B: The acknowledgement number in the server response has not incremented for 100 exchanges.
choices.D: LLDP is disabled on the switch.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Correct is A

Correct answer is A
DCBX exchanges are control messages used to negotiate and configure Data Center Bridging (DCB) settings. If the connected host does not respond to these exchanges, it can lead to this error.

questions.question_text: A Cisco Nexus Series interface is errdisabled with the error message "DCX-No ACK in 100 PDUs". What is the cause of this error?
